definitions.definition: a person who is very interested in something and spends a lot of time doing it

examples.text: She was an enthusiast for early Italian art.
Railway enthusiasts were given the chance to ride on the old steam train during the weekend.
She was a lifelong enthusiast of dancing, running and waterskiing.

definitions.definition: a person who approves of something and shows enthusiasm for it

examples.text: They are great enthusiasts of the American work ethic.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (denoting a person believing that they are divinely inspired): from French enthousiaste or ecclesiastical Latin enthusiastes ‘member of a heretical sect’, from Greek enthousiastēs ‘person inspired by a god’, from the adjective enthous ‘possessed by a god, inspired’ (based on theos ‘god’).
